Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean...a reasonable choice if your expectations are pitched at the right level”
Reviews.Author: Milano_Eddie
Reviews.Content: This is not the sort of hotel anybody is going to rave about, you have to realise that. I stayed there because, due to a trade show in Amsterdam, all the mid-price hotels seemed to be fully booked or to have doubled their prices. The alternatives were numerous places with awful reviews on Tripadvisor (dirty rooms, dodgy plumbing and bad service). So given this I was pleased with my stay here at the Campanile, because the rooms were clean, the plumbing was fine (lots of hot water in a reasonably spacious bathroom) and the service was good. Now, the rooms have a cheap feel and are not large, but there's a decent flat screen TV and there are coffee making facilities. The bed was comfortable. The room was warm (very important, as it was -8Â°C outside). The rooms are accessed from the outside, motel-style, which might annoy the easily annoyed... Breakfast was good enough (although during my three breakfasts the scrambled egg and bacon trays always seemed to be nearly empty when I arrived....I assume this was just bad luck on my part). As for the location, yes it's a long way out of the centre, and beautiful it is not (but neither is it particularly rough or does it feel particularly dangerous). But it's very close (literally 100 metres) from the Gaasperplas metro stop on the end of the red line, with trains to Centraal Station every 10 minutes (and easy to get to RAI station, where I was working, with one change). I probably wouldn't stay here again unless I had to (because alternatives nearer the centre were fully booked) but in such a scenario I would certainly prefer to stay here than in some noisy, dirty dump in a more touristy area for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: punitworld
Reviews.Content: Misled by some good remarks and I booked this Hotel to find that this is a very average Hotel that is very close to public transport. Whilst I did not have any major issues, I was amazed by ordinary and basic furniture, uncovered pathways from reception to room (big problem if temperature is minus 10). Budget wise also, I have stayed in better hotels for lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Campanile Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: Great location if staying in the city is too expensive or noisy etc...

Reviews.Title: “Location brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Seanamall
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, quite basic but does the job if your out exploring all day. Staff really helpful and the rooms clean. A little surprised that it was sort of like a motel in style. Right beside the end of the red tram line so all you have to do is hop on and go right to the other end and your in the city centre!

Reviews.Title: “Good for 2 nights”
Reviews.Author: CristianTalos
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel for you or a group of friends. 25 m near metro station. 25 minutes to amsterdam central. Clean towels, clean bed, small rooms but confortable. Will come back for the next budget fast trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Do not expect any frills”
Reviews.Author: SteveBMidlands_UK
Reviews.Content: So long as you do not expect frills or comfort, this hotel will suit you. As I am writing this from the room I can confirm is has no comfort, the radiators are either too hot or cold and this chair is like sitting on a rock. That said is is better than a UK Travelodge, but that is not hard to achieve. This is winter and it gets dark early and the area around the hotel, Gassperplaas, is not safe for a white guy alone after dark, in fact one of the restaurant owners in the Centrum seemed quite concerned for my safety when I told him where I was staying. I think it would be fine in the summer as there is a lake and open space around it, but I simply caught the Metro into the centre each evening and only used the room for sleeping, but also did not come back too late either on advice from locals. The Metro station next door saves this, unless you are using it for a single night whilst travelling I would not recommend it, I have been here for a week and cannot wait to get out of Amsterdam, although I am not impressed with the city either, it seems focussed on sex and drugs and anything tacky related to it. Having said all that, in the summer i am sure the hotel would have a different image. It does have free internet though

Reviews.Title: “A verry good hotel”
Reviews.Author: erwig
Reviews.Content: We arrived before 12am and could go directly to the room after unpacking we went to the bar for some drinks the person of the reception where two friendly persons they even give us the remote controle because we were the only guest at the moment in the bar so we could choose a tv chanel. After visiting amsterdam we went with the nightbus to the hotel so in the day verry quick with the metro in the night with the bus stop direct before hotel. It was verry late but we still could get some drinks at the bar. ONE WORD IT'S THE BEST if you would like to visit amsterdam and go out in amsterdam book this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jaxben
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Amsterdam and found this holtel perfect. We parked our car and used the bus to get into Amsterdam, no problem. The hotel was clean, friendly and very comfortable. Would recommend this hotel to any one and will definately be the only place we stay when visiting the city. Great place, lovely staff, thank you for a really good time.

Reviews.Title: “not a hotel I will be re-booking”
Reviews.Author: MasqueradeUK
Reviews.Content: OK, maybe this review is slightly tainted by the fact that despite this being the closest hotel to my company's Amsterdam office, it is still a 50 minute walk. I could have claimed more expenses and stayed near the airport. (a definate option for next time) The Campanile Amsterdam is a no frills hotel, with a very limited menu in the restaurant, not particularly fast service, and a bit of a laid-back atmosphere. I don't think I'm a particularly fussy eater, but there were only two choices I would have gone for on the menu. I plumped for the Lasagne, which was described as "Bolognese Lasagne", but I could barely find more than a few crumbs of beef between the soggy slices of pasta. There wasn't much other sauce either, plus it was extremely hot having come straight from the microwave. So I asked for a side-order of chips, which when eventually delivered, my pasta was nearly cold. If you are on a back-packing tour, this place is ideal. As a business hotel it's a dead-loss.

Reviews.Title: “Basic accommodation very near the metro station”
Reviews.Author: uktravel100
Reviews.Content: I will recommend with place for anybody looking for a basic accommodation with convenient transport to city centre. Metro station is just outside the hotel. Hotel itself is quite. Good value for money. There was good parking outside for those coming by car. For me it was easy to find the place after I arrived by air.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading description”
Reviews.Author: jorn51
Reviews.Content: I booked a triple room In this hotel after having read the description on web page. The description said â€œone king size plus one queen size bedâ€�. In reality it turned out to be a double room with king size bed and a cot put next to it. The beds were OK, but it was not the same standard as promised and there was hardly any floor space left, so it was difficult to move in the room. Definitely it was not worth the EUR 105 they charged for this. Additionally at check out they charged me additionally EUR 4 for â€œcity taxâ€� which they never mentioned before. This was my first and probably last stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with good transportation links”
Reviews.Author: wallerthegreat
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel with a cool urban style beach near by and excellent value transportation links into town. The only concern is some areas near by look a bit "gangster".

Reviews.Title: “OK for truckers”
Reviews.Author: wardster
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night. The hotel is basically a truck stop situated near the Amsterdam motorway system. The rooms are very basic and not all that clean. They face onto outside walkways as per US budget motel chains. There is an attached restaurant serving nice but limited and basic food (steak and chips, lasagne etc). At night some local tired looking hookers try picking up the visiting truck drivers in the small bar area. There is nothing around the hotel except a metro station to take you into Amsterdam centre. If youâ€™d like staying at a motorway service station youâ€™ll like this; but donâ€™t come here for an anniversary or you will leave single.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place if you don't mind being out of the city”
Reviews.Author: CrispyRice
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Campanile just fine. It's on the edge of a gorgeous park, which was a nice peaceful place to walk around and relax a bit. We'd stay there again, especially if we had a car and wanted to stay on the outskirts of Amsterdam and take the metro in. Just make sure to plan to find food elsewhere and don't plan on popping back to the hotel in the afternoon for a break. The Campanile is indeed out in the suburbs of Amsterdam - about 15 to 20 minutes at the end of the Gaasperplas metro line. (You'll need 4 strip tix per person to get in or out.) But we got a rate of 44 Euros per night, which more than made up for spending a bit of time on the metro. We also wanted to spend some time along the coast by Weesp and take a trip to Utrecht, so we were well-positioned for both those. There are busses to Bijlmer Station and to Weesp from right outside the hotel, too. The rooms are small, but we weren't there to sit in a hotel. The room was clean and everything worked just fine. The coffee / tea and biscuit service is a nice touch. It has a set-up like a motel, where all the doors open to the outside, but you do have to go through the lobby to get to the rooms. There are blinds you can lower on your window which make the room very private and pitch-dark, too. One drawback for us was the lack of food in the area. There is a restaurant on the premises, but breakfast is not included in the room price. They wanted 11 Euros for a breakfast buffet, which we didn't want to pay. Unfortunately, there are no bakeries or other options close by. In fact, you can't follow along the streets, but rather the neighborhood has a series of walking paths between the housing developments. We had to go to the Bijlmer Station (where we caught a train to Utrecht) to find a shopping district with grocery stores, restaurants, etc. It didn't look that far on the map, but due to the windy paths and to some construction we probably took 40 minutes to get there. (The bus takes about 10 minutes.) There was a snack truck in the park where we ended up eating a couple nights, and he actually had several decent and cheap choices. Plan to eat in Amsterdam if you're going into town. One more note - I got a cold while in Amsterdam and we decided to cut our visit short by a day. The Campanile had no problem with this and didn't charge us any fees or anything for leaving early. I'll give it a rating of 4/5 because it was just what we needed - a clean room with a comfy bed at a fantastic price with easy access to town.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice”
Reviews.Author: Jolinda
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a big disappointment for us, nothing what we expected. Hotel website and pictures are very misleading. My husband and I booked this hotel for 3 nights, but upon arrival, I did not want to even check in, but, I had already confirmed with my credit card and would be charged anyway for the first night, so we stayed, but the next morning we checked out. I will not stay here again or recommend this hotel to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lachantelle
Reviews.Content: Perfect location: near to the highway, subway, the city etc. Simple, extremely thin-walled but clean rooms. Reception gave us the wrong information about 48 public transportation card, a ticket strip would have been much cheaper! They blamed public transportation, took no responsibility! Breakfast: staff squeeze fresh orangejuice just for the show: the jugs for the guests are filled from a juicebox. There were 2 sorts of croissants, simple backery and toast. Lots of canned sandwich fillings, but also fresh meat, cheese, scrambled eggs and bacon. Staff compensated their fault by letting us use their parking space on the last day of our stay. For just 1 night it is an ok place to stay but I would not recommand a stay longer than that! You might not get enough sleep because of the noises around you.

Reviews.Title: “small budget size rooms - not budget price”
Reviews.Author: traumatizer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Campanile for 2 nights as part of a budget European tour. The Campanile was the most expensive hotel on our tour but it wasnt the best. The rooms are clean but small. Tea and coffee making facilites are included, breakfast was extra on top of our rate (we didnt bother, we eat breakfast in Amsterdam) the hotels main selling point for us was the free car park and the fact that it was right next to Gaspaarplas metro station which gets you to Centraal Station in about 20 minutes. The room was 100 euros per night for a family of 3. The "extra" child bed wasnt of a great standard, but sufficed.

Reviews.Title: “Great basic hotel & perfect location for the money!”
Reviews.Author: pandora2
Reviews.Content: My 3 friends & I booked the Campanile via the web in October. The pictures were an accurate representation of the hotel, which we found to be charming, if basic! The rooms were clean & comfortable w/ a large, tiled bathrrom (with a heater!) including a bath tub & shower. Our 3rd flr. rooms had shiny, wooden floors, & a large window facing a balcony which overlooked a wonderful nature park behind the hotel. I also liked the double-door,'vestibule' entrance to each hotel room. Fluffy featherbeds were especially nice & cosy & the large picture window of our room had a metal shade which could be lowered for privacy & security. There was an electric teapot, coffee, tea & cookies in our room each day. Upon check-in, when we found ourselves in a smoking room, the manager kindly switched us immediately to a non-smoking room with no problem! Our roooms were tidied each day of our 3-night stay. The hotel cafe was a little 'pricey' & had a limited menu for dinner, but it was fine for coffee & lunch and it even had a lovely outdoor patio seating area. The hotel location is at the end of the metro line at Gaasparplas - I liked being only 20 minutes away from Central Station (downtown Amsterdam). A word of caution, however, if you miss the last metro at 11:30 p.m. you'll have to take the night bus-which can be a very l-o-n-g ride! This wouldn't deter me from staying here again, however, as I found the hotel staff friendly, the hotel clean & the hotel clientele an agreeable assortment of adult leisure travelers, students & international tourists. The hotel lobby is locked after 12 midnight-which made me feel safe & the surrounding park gives one the feeling of the country-side even though you're quite near the city. All in all, a lovely hotel for the price!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: FarmerJohn74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Campanile to visit the U2 concert at Amsterdam Arena. The Campanile is right next to metro station Gaasperplas. The metro takes you to Centraal Station in about 20 mins., a bus goes directly to Biljmerstation/A'dam Arena (ca. 15 min). Unfortunately rooms are _very_ small. Its mainly a bed and nothing else. So if you are only looking for a place to stay(sleep) it maybe ok, but don't expect anything special. Staff was friendly. When we arrived we got a room which hadn't been cleaned up. We told the reception and the lady there said we could change the room if we wanted. We were on our way to the city so we decided not to change and she said that the service would clean the room. Unfortunately this hadn't happened when we arrived again and we had to go to the reception again.

Reviews.Title: “Good startingpoint for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found an advertisment in a dutch magazin: a.o. special offer for Campanile Hotel Amsterdam, 2 nights, breakfast and diner for a special price. We booked through the internet and after a while recieved conformation and information about the hotel with beautifull pictures of the diner- and breakfast-buffet. There was also a note about the fact that the advertisment was a little unclear about the diner(s) and just 1 diner was included. Oke, no trouble. We went there and found our room very nice and comfortable. A welkomtray with a waterboiler, coffee, thee, milk, sugar and cookies in our room wich was refilled the second day. The only negative point was eating in the restaurant. Its partly selfservice, but for drinks and extra's you need to order. The girl that took the orders was called away twice while taking our order and we ended up with half of the orderd drinks and no knifes and forks. Also both the diner- and breakfast buffet offerd less then was in the pictures and in the morning they could not tell me what was on the menu in the evening. Having breakfast half an hour for closingtime ment we could only choose from two sorts of bread and a few left over slices of meat and cheese. During our breakfast ( still within breakfast time) they started cleaning up and removed most of the food and drinks. Staying at the campanile gives you a great startingpoint for visiting Amsterdam, its just a few meters from the Metro, but don't expect to much of the food.

HotelInfo.Name: Campanile Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Loosdrechtdreef 3, Amsterdam 1108 AX, The Netherlands
